datafield.subfield: sponsored by the American Folklife Center ; assisted by the National Council for the Traditional Arts.
13 sound tape reels : analog, 7 1/2 ips, double track, mono. ; 10 in.
20 photographic prints : black and white, color; various sizes

The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs documenting the performance of blues music, Cambodian classical dance, bluegrass music, country-western music, Armenian music, cowboy songs, Piedmont country blues music and buck (step) dance, and country blues music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Library of Congress.
Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress)
National Council for the Traditional Arts,

publicationstmt.publisher: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: The collection consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs documenting the performance of blues music, Cambodian classical dance, bluegrass music, country-western music, Armenian music, cowboy songs, Piedmont country blues music and buck (step) dance, and country blues music recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Library of Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1983 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection consists of manuscript and print materials, audio recordings, and graphic materials that document the 1983 concert series sponsored by the American Folklife Center. The annual series, which began in 1977, features the presentation of folk traditions from many cultures. The concerts take place on the Neptune Plaza at the front of the Jefferson Building of the Library of Congress between May and September. Adverse weather conditions sometimes force the concerts indoors. The 1983 series was produced with the assistance of the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

The 1983 season consisted of the following:
Date Performers Place of Origin Subject
April 21 John Jackson and James Jackson Virginia Blues music
May 13 Khmer Classical Ballet Maryland Cambodian music and dance
May 19 Grass Reflections Virginia Bluegrass music
June 3 The Deseret String Band Utah Western music
June 16 Leo Sarkisian District of Columbia Armenian music
July 21 Glenn Ohrlin Arkansas Cowboy music
August 18 "Fris" Holloway and John Dee Holeman North Carolina Country blues music and buck dancing
September 15 Country Edd Michael and his group Virginia Country blues fiddle music

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Documentation created and accessioned by the American Folklife Center in 1983.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress) collector.
National Council for the Traditional Arts, sponsor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Listening and viewing access to the collection is unrestricted. Duplication of the materials requires prior permission of the Center and may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1983 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection (AFC 1983/009), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

row.entry: The group consists of former members of the Cambodian Royal Classical Khmer Ballet who became refugees and eventually were relocated to Wheaton, MD. Performance features four short theater pieces (without stories). Rich Kennedy of the National Council for the Traditional Arts narrates the performance. Sound recording notes: folder 4; photographs and slides: folder 5, envelope 5; sound recording: RWA 5725. See also 9-31-81 concert.
Documentation of Armenian folk dance is minimal. Photographs: folder 12. See also 5-8-80 concert.

Piedmont Blues musicians and buck dancers. The men take turns dancing and hand clapping ("patting juba," "hand jiving," "hamboning") for each other. Print material: folder 15; photographs: folder 16; sound recordings: RWA 6445-46.
